items.label: thm-derivation-of-stability-condition
items.title: Derivation of the Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation
items.content:
3951: :label: thm-derivation-of-stability-condition
3952: 
3953: Let the system satisfy the foundational axioms, including the **Axiom of Non-Deceptive Landscapes (EG-7)**. Let a swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) `k` have a sufficiently large internal positional variance, $\mathrm{Var}_x(S_k) > R^2_{\mathrm{var}}$.
3954: 
3955: The algorithm's targeting mechanism is "intelligent" (i.e., the expected fitness of a high-error walker ({prf:ref}`def-walker`) is systematically lower than that of a low-error walker) if and only if the system parameters ($\alpha$, $\beta$, $\varepsilon$, etc.) satisfy the following **Stability Condition**:
3956: 
3957: $$
3958: \beta \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\text{mean},d'}(\epsilon)}{g_{A,max}+\eta}\right) > \alpha \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\text{mean},r'}}{\eta}\right)
3959: $$
items.section: ## 7. The Corrective Nature of Fitness: From Signal Generation to Intelligent Adaptation
items.raw_directive:
3948: This property is not unconditional. We will rigorously derive a **Stability Condition** on the algorithm's dynamics parameters ($\alpha$, $\beta$, $\varepsilon$) from first principles. The proof will be statistical in nature, analyzing the expected fitness of the entire "high-error" population versus the "low-error" population. We will demonstrate that satisfying this Stability Condition is the necessary and sufficient condition to guarantee that the high-error walkers are, on average, less fit. This derivation provides the formal justification for elevating this condition to the status of a foundational axiom for any well-posed Fragile Gas system.
3949: 
3950: :::{prf:theorem} Derivation of the Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation

items.label: thm-stability-condition-final-corrected
items.title: **(The Corrected Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation)**
items.content:
4550: :label: thm-stability-condition-final-corrected
4551: 
4552: Let a swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) `k$ be in a high-error state. The algorithm's targeting mechanism is intelligent (i.e., $\mathbb{E}[\ln(V_{\text{fit}})|H_k] < \mathbb{E}[\ln(V_{\text{fit}})|L_k]$) if and only if the system parameters satisfy the following **Corrected Stability Condition**:
4553: $$
4554: \beta \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{d', \text{mean}}}{g_{A,\max}+\eta}\right) > \alpha \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\mathrm{rescaled}}(L_{R} \cdot D_{\mathrm{valid}})}{\eta}\right)

items.label: thm-unfit-high-error-overlap-fraction
items.title: N-Uniform Lower Bound on the Unfit-High-Error Overlap Fraction
items.content:
4672: :label: thm-unfit-high-error-overlap-fraction
4673: 
4674: Let a swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) state satisfy $V_{\mathrm{struct}} > R^2_{\mathrm{spread}}$. Let $U_k$ be the unfit set for swarm `k` and let $H_k(\epsilon)$ be its corresponding unified high-error set.
4675: 
4676: If the **Stability Condition** ([](#thm-stability-condition-final-corrected)) holds for the chosen system parameters, then the fraction of alive walkers in the intersection set $I_{UH} = U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$ is bounded below by a positive, N-uniform constant:
4677: 
4678: $$
4679: \frac{|I_{UH}|}{k} \ge f_{UH}(\epsilon) > 0
4680: $$

This is the ultimate proof of the Keystone Principle's corrective feedback loop.

items.label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
items.title: Compositional Structure of $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
items.content:
6223: :label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
6224: 
6225: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) admits the following compositional representation:
6226: 
6227: $$
6228: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot) = \int_{\mathbf{d}} \int_{\mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}} \Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot) \, dP_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d}), \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}) \, dP_{\text{measure}}(S, \mathbf{d})
6229: $$
6230: 
6231: where:
6232: - $P_{\text{measure}}(S, \cdot)$ is the distribution of raw distance vectors from $\Psi_{\text{measure}}$
6233: - $\mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d})$ is the deterministic fitness vector from $\Psi_{\text{fitness}}$ given $S$ and $\mathbf{d}$
6234: - $P_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}, \cdot)$ is the joint distribution of companion assignments and actions
6235: - $\Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot)$ is the (possibly stochastic) output distribution given the actions
6236: 
6237: This composition is a proper Markov kernel ({prf:ref}`def-markov-kernel`): for any measurable set $A \subseteq \Sigma_N$,
6238: 
6239: $$
6240: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, A) = P(S' \in A \mid S)
6241: $$
6242: 
6243: is a well-defined probability.
items.raw_directive:
6220: We now assemble the complete operator from its components.
6221: 
6222: :::{prf:theorem} Compositional Structure of $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
6223: :label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
6224: 
6225: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) admits the following compositional representation:
6226: 
6227: $$
6228: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot) = \int_{\mathbf{d}} \int_{\mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}} \Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot) \, dP_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d}), \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}) \, dP_{\text{measure}}(S, \mathbf{d})
6229: $$
6230: 
6231: where:
6232: - $P_{\text{measure}}(S, \cdot)$ is the distribution of raw distance vectors from $\Psi_{\text{measure}}$
6233: - $\mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d})$ is the deterministic fitness vector from $\Psi_{\text{fitness}}$ given $S$ and $\mathbf{d}$
6234: - $P_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}, \cdot)$ is the joint distribution of companion assignments and actions
6235: - $\Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot)$ is the (possibly stochastic) output distribution given the actions
6236: 
6237: This composition is a proper Markov kernel ({prf:ref}`def-markov-kernel`): for any measurable set $A \subseteq \Sigma_N$,
6238: 
6239: $$
6240: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, A) = P(S' \in A \mid S)
6241: $$
6242: 
6243: is a well-defined probability.

items.label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
items.title: Positional Variance Contraction Under Cloning
items.content:
6410: :label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
6411: 
6412: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), there exist constants $\kappa_x > 0$, $C_x < \infty$, and a structural error threshold $R^2_{\text{spread}} > 0$, all independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
6413: 
6414: $$
6415: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_x) V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + C_x
6416: $$
6417: 
6418: Furthermore, when $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_x$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_x$, the contraction becomes strict:
6419: 
6420: $$
6421: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) - V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2)] < 0
6422: $$
items.raw_directive:

6418: Furthermore, when $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_x$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_x$, the contraction becomes strict:

items.label: thm-complete-variance-drift
items.title: Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
items.content:
6942: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6943: 
6944: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6945: 
6946: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6947: 
6948: $$
6949: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6950: $$
6951: 
6952: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6953: 
6954: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6955: 
6956: $$
6957: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6958: $$
6959: 
6960: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6961: 
6962: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6963: 
6964: $$
6965: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6966: $$
items.raw_directive:
6939: We conclude by summarizing the main drift results for the variance components under $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$.
6940: 
6941: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
6942: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6943: 
6944: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6945: 
6946: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6947: 
6948: $$
6949: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6950: $$
6951: 
6952: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6953: 
6954: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6955: 
6956: $$
6957: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6958: $$
6959: 
6960: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6961: 
6962: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6963: 
6964: $$
6965: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)

items.label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
items.title: Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
items.content:
7340: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7341: 
7342: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor ({prf:ref}`axiom-safe-harbor`) Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7343: 
7344: $$
7345: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7346: $$
7347: 
7348: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7349: 
7350: $$
7351: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7352: $$
items.raw_directive:
7337: ## 11.3. Main Theorem: Boundary Potential Contraction
7338: 
7339: :::{prf:theorem} Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
7340: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7341: 
7342: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor ({prf:ref}`axiom-safe-harbor`) Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7343: 
7344: $$
7345: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7346: $$
7347: 
7348: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7349: 
7350: $$
7351: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7352: $$

items.label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
items.title: Complete Boundary Potential Drift Characterization
items.content:
7783: :label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
7784: 
7785: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the boundary potential:
7786: 
7787: $$
7788: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b
7789: $$
7790: 
7791: where:
7792: - $\kappa_b = p_{\text{boundary}}(\phi_{\text{thresh}}) > 0$ is the minimum cloning probability for boundary-exposed walkers
7793: - $C_b = O(\sigma_x^2 + N^{-1})$ accounts for position jitter and dead walker ({prf:ref}`def-walker`) revival
7794: - Both constants are **$N$-independent** in the large-$N$ limit
7795: 
7796: **Key Properties:**
7797: 
7798: 1. **Unconditional contraction:** The drift is negative for all states with $W_b > C_b/\kappa_b$
7799: 
7800: 2. **Strengthening near danger:** The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ increases with boundary proximity (through $\phi_{\text{thresh}}$)
items.raw_directive:
7780: We conclude by stating the complete boundary potential drift result.
7781: 
7782: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Boundary Potential Drift Characterization
7783: :label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
7784: 
7785: The cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the boundary potential:
7786: 
7787: $$
7788: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b
7789: $$
7790: 
7791: where:
7792: - $\kappa_b = p_{\text{boundary}}(\phi_{\text{thresh}}) > 0$ is the minimum cloning probability for boundary-exposed walkers
7793: - $C_b = O(\sigma_x^2 + N^{-1})$ accounts for position jitter and dead walker ({prf:ref}`def-walker`) revival
7794: - Both constants are **$N$-independent** in the large-$N$ limit
7795: 
7796: **Key Properties:**
7797: 
7798: 1. **Unconditional contraction:** The drift is negative for all states with $W_b > C_b/\kappa_b$
7799: 
7800: 2. **Strengthening near danger:** The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ increases with boundary proximity (through $\phi_{\text{thresh}}$)

items.content:
8053: :label: thm-complete-wasserstein-drift
8054: 
8055: The total inter-swarm ({prf:ref}`def-swarm-and-state-space`) Wasserstein distance ({prf:ref}`def-n-particle-displacement-metric`) $V_W = V_{\text{loc}} + V_{\text{struct}}$ satisfies a combined drift inequality under the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`):
8056: 
8057: $$
8058: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] \leq C_W
8059: $$
8060: 
8061: where $C_W < \infty$ is a state-independent constant satisfying:
8062: 
8063: $$
8064: C_W = C_{\text{loc}} + C_{\text{struct}}
8065: $$
8066: 
8067: **Component Bounds:**
8068: 
8069: From {prf:ref}`cor-component-bounds-vw`, the individual components satisfy:
8070: 
8071: $$
8072: \begin{aligned}
8073: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] &\leq C_{\text{loc}} \\
8074: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] &\leq C_{\text{struct}}
8075: \end{aligned}
8076: $$
8077: 
8078: where:
8079: - $C_{\text{loc}}$ arises from barycenter desynchronization due to differential cloning rates
8080: - $C_{\text{struct}}$ arises from jitter noise and structural rearrangement during cloning
8081: 
8082: **Note on Kinetic Contraction:**
8083: 
8084: While the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) allows bounded expansion of $V_W$, the **kinetic operator ({prf:ref}`def-kinetic-operator`)** provides contraction. From hypocoercive analysis (Chapter 4 of companion document):
8085: 
8086: $$
8087: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_W] \leq -\kappa_W^{\text{kin}} \tau V_W + C_W^{\text{kin}} \tau
8088: $$

items.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
items.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
items.content:
8145: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8146: 
8147: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ (see {prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator-formal`) induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8148: 
8149: $$
8150: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8151: $$
8152: 
8153: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8154: 
8155: $$
8156: \begin{aligned}
8157: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8158: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8159: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8160: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8161: \end{aligned}
8162: $$
8163: 
8164: **Combined Drift:**
8165: 
8166: $$
8167: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8168: $$
8169: 
8170: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8171: 
8172: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8173: 
8174: $$
8175: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}

items.label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
items.title: Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)
items.content:
8294: :label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8295: 
8296: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov ({prf:ref}`def-foster-lyapunov`) drift condition:
8297: 
8298: $$
8299: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8300: $$
8301: 
8302: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8303: 
8304: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8305: 1. **Geometric ergodicity ({prf:ref}`def-geometric-ergodicity`)** of the Markov chain on the alive state space

8291: ### 12.4.2. The Synergistic Drift Inequality
8292: 
8293: :::{prf:theorem} Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)
8294: :label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8295: 
8296: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov ({prf:ref}`def-foster-lyapunov`) drift condition:
8297: 
8298: $$
8299: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8300: $$
8301: 
8302: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8303: 
8304: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8305: 1. **Geometric ergodicity ({prf:ref}`def-geometric-ergodicity`)** of the Markov chain on the alive state space
8306: 2. **Exponential convergence** to the quasi-stationary distribution ({prf:ref}`def-qsd`)

items.label: thm-main-results-summary
items.title: Main Results of the Cloning Analysis (Summary)
items.content:
8460: :label: thm-main-results-summary
8461: 
8462: This document has established the following results for the cloning operator ({prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator`) $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$:
8463: 
8464: **1. The Keystone Principle (Chapters 5-8):**
8465: - Large internal positional variance → detectable geometric structure
8466: - Geometric structure → reliable fitness signal (N-uniform)
8467: - Fitness signal → corrective cloning pressure
8468: - **Result:** $\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i \in I_{11}} (p_{1,i} + p_{2,i})\|\Delta\delta_{x,i}\|^2 \geq \chi(\epsilon) V_{\text{struct}} - g_{\max}(\epsilon)$
8469: 
8470: **2. Positional Variance Contraction (Chapter 10):**
8471: - The Keystone Principle translates to rigorous drift inequality
8472: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x$
8473: - Contraction rate $\kappa_x > 0$ is **N-uniform**
8474: 
8475: **3. Velocity Variance Bounded Expansion (Chapter 10):**
8476: - Inelastic collisions cause state-independent perturbation
8477: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v$
8478: - Expansion is **bounded**, not growing with system state or size
8479: 
8480: **4. Boundary Potential Contraction (Chapter 11):**
8481: - Safe Harbor ({prf:ref}`axiom-safe-harbor`) mechanism systematically removes boundary-proximate walkers
8482: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b$
8483: - Provides **exponentially suppressed extinction probability**
8484: 
8485: **5. Complete Characterization (Chapter 12):**
8486: - All drift constants are **N-independent** (scalable to large swarms)
8487: - Cloning provides **partial contraction** of the Lyapunov function
8488: - Requires **kinetic operator ({prf:ref}`def-kinetic-operator`)** to overcome bounded expansions
8489: - Foundation for **synergistic Foster-Lyapunov ({prf:ref}`def-foster-lyapunov`) condition**
